review: I miss the old building and a game room for the kids.  Still good service and burgers,  always plenty to eat. Thicker ranch would be nice and I still enjoy the soups.

Very upset with the way the female night manager handled a minor argument between my gf and i. I went outside to smoke a cigarette, and she called the police for domestic violence, which was a lie for one, and for two, she lied to them about what had taken place, acting like it was an emergency and someone had been assaulted, which was 100% not the case. Anyway, cops came, no one got arrested, because no crime was commited. And needless to say due to domestic violence laws in washington state the police put a unwanted order of protection between my girlfriend and I. So neither of us wanted it put on! So she essentially ruined my relationship by making a call to the police in which she lied about what was going on! Which is why im posting this. That's not the whole story but it's most of it. I hope some people see this and decide to go to Bobs Burgers Instead! The food is much better there anyways, and they are much more accommodating and catering, instead of rude, judgemental liars
I came for the $7 burgers. The burgers are smaller than the traditional ones. However with the bottomless fries no one goes home hungry

Well it's undergone a number of renovations and facelifts, this red Robin has been a staple in the area for a long time and continues to deliver on its promise of delicious burgers and lots of fries! In its new building, the place seems to have a smaller footprint, but actually boasts more seating and room for customers. Standard dining rooms, as well as a nice bar area to the left. They do a good job of getting people in and out quickly, and the servers are always friendly, often bringing you extra fries and your choice of sauce! It's the little things after all. We always appreciate the rotating selection of burgers and the fact that they often have something that's a little bit less expensive if that's what you're looking for. Great spot for family and friends!

Save your money and go somewhere better. I ordered curbside service. After waiting 20 min, I tried calling and no one answered. So, I went inside. I told them I had been waiting for 20 min and they told me you have to call because they can't see the curbside parking spaces.  Um, just tried and they didn't answer. Plus there wasn't anything stating you needed to call to let them know you were here on the sign or in the email confirmation.  Ended up with cold food that wasn't any better than a fast food burger place that charges half the price.  And no apologies for the confusion or cold food. Won't be coming back.

Terrible service.  No drinks offered when seated, no utensils, screwed up 2/5 orders, put bacon on my veggie patty, gave the wrong substitutions, & charged us for their screw-ups.  Most likely not going back.  Quite fun with 3 hungry kids.

I'm a fan of Red Robin! They've won me over entirely. As far as a burger chain goes, Red Robin, especially this location, has never disappointed me. Many burger places lack depth or a variety of flavor in their burgers, leaving a heavy dark flavor in the mouth. Red Robin, somehow, has managed to create a flavor profile that feels light, varied and interesting with each burger on the menu. The bottomless fries are excellent, and I recommend a couple of pots of campfire sauce to go with. This location in particular is pretty nice looking and the staff have always been friendlier than most restaurants, with a passion and interest in the job they're doing. When I'm in the mood of a burger, it is always this place!

It was 5:30 pm Thursday evening. We were seated immediately even though it seemed a bit packed. Our food was served to us pretty quickly and our server Samantha was awesome. Defiantly one of my favorite chain restaurants in Yakima.

Everytime i come here with my team somehow they always end up picking this restaurant.(not very many options in this town on a sunday night) Our servers are always slow and very inattentive. I have been to plenty of other locations with better service though.

OK, Red Robin is fairly predictable as far as food quality goes. They moved from the old location next door to this new building, which looks great. The place was packed (as Yakima Red Robin always has been).  I could not belive how poor the service was! It took almost 15 mintues for the beer to arrive once ordered, the burgers came about 25 mintues later and the extra fries we ordered when they dropped the burgers off at the table came when we were ready to leave.

I have been to several Red Robin restaurants and have been pleased with the service and the food. This one however will never have my business again. The food was awful. Service was terrible and we waited more than 1/2 hour to get a table! My son even had to go to the serving area to get utensils!!
Awful! We waited over an hour to get our food. My 20 month old child ended up with food poisoning from the kids mac n' cheese. Never again!

My wife and I have been really impressed with RR. We went in for the first time in their new location several weeks ago. We had stopped going to their former location due to two experiences with extremely poor service.  Things have changed dramatically for the better as we have been back to RR 6 times in the past two two months. The service is quick, friendly, and the bar menu double burgers are perfect for us to split with the bottomless fries.  Local brew on tap is a total bonus; I mean who doesn't love a Top Cutter with a burger!   We plan to make RR a regular eatery for lunches.

Second time trying the new location.... -arrived at 3 pm on a Saturday to a very unfriendly hostess, was told it'd be a 10 minute wait even though there was lots of seating available  - waitress was pleasant and brought are drinks quickly but our food took forever to arrive  - my burger was good, one daughter had chicken strips which were fine the other tried the tavern mac and cheese- very little flavor wouldn't recommend it - the three of us in our party agreed we won't be going back for the reasons above and we don't enjoy the new restaurant layout it's very loud and the seating is uncomfortably tight along with the temperature always being cold Really miss the old restaurant - better service and atmosphere....
They gave me my rootbeer float in 2 glasses rootbeer in one and ice cream in the other. It was a messy to pour. Very loud i couldnt hear the waitress.

We went on a Saturday afternoon and while it was busy it wasn't packed; yet it took over a half hour to seat our party of 5 adults and 4 children even though I could clearly see tables empty that could have been pushed together. At least 5 smaller parties who arrived after us were seated before we were. We almost left to go somewhere else and I wish we had because the food was definitely not worth the wait. Our drinks came quickly but the food took another 1/2 hour and one of the burgers had to be sent back because the server had entered the wrong one so mom waited an extra 15min for her burger. All the burgers were over cooked and dry - even the croissant sandwich my niece ordered was dry (super stale croissant). I ordered a bottomless drink and when I got it I thought it tasted strange - my sister took a sip and told me it was alcoholic: I don't drink ever and had to send the drink back and wait for another. When our food came out, it came without utensils or napkins. We had 9 people needing napkins and forks and we couldn't flag the waitress, who -bless her heart was trying her best to wait too many tables at once, so my husband got up and hunted down utensils and napkins and brought them back to our table. Oh, and my sisters Cesar salad was saaaad - how are there no croutons in a Cesar salad?!? The kids enjoyed their kids meals (though my nephew said his sprite tasted weird which it did and had to be sent back as well). For the price, neither the food nor the service was worth it. Next time we will go to Mod Pizza across the way or the Kabob House on the other side, and if I'm craving a burger I'll hit Bobs or even Burger King, which would be better. Very disappointing - we won't be back.

New building is small, and loud. Our self order and self pay keosk tablet at the table looked to be a bacteria and food magnet. Staff was inexperienced but that's expected at a place like Red Robin. Food was average.  New location is a down grade, probably won't go again anytime soon.
The food is always great. Waiters are always friendly and quick to seat you. Never go in on a Friday or Saturday night or there'll be a two hour wait. Great service always. Fave place in Yakima

If only I could give 1/2 star, I would. Really sliding. Waited a long time for food. Food that was cold. Drinks out after our meal. Our server spent most of the time MIA. Even went to the kitchen to get her once.  The kitchen seems to be enjoying a lively social hour.....but out in the dining hall. Lots of unhappy people. We had unpleasant experiences the last two times here......this puts the icing on the cake. Will not be back. Plenty of good burger joints in Yakima & this is no longer one of them.

We decided to get takeout and I wanted to see if they have improved since their reopening. I can say, no they haven't. Soggy, cold fries, soggy buns, burnt burger patty and way over salted turkey burger patty. Spending over $30, we should receive at least hot food. Another lesson learned. No more Red Robin for this family.

Clearly an establishment based on previous market appeal. Service is mediocre and inexperienced however the people were nice at face value. On a rather busy Tuesday I decided to sit at the bar because the wait for a table was long & the open tables in the bar area were not bussed; they remained dirty for 10 minutes or so while I drank at the bar; food for three people took over 25 minutes. Fries were consistently cold and soggy despite being "endless." Our server was nice and clearly lacking support. This place lacks the capability to adequately serve the tables it provides. --- The food, as likely with red robin, was tasty however, given the rest of the experience, 2.5-3 stars is a stretch and only given so because of the nice bar tender and reliable Red Robin menu. ... Would not return unless craving Red Robin.
A favorite lunch hangout for my coworkers and I on Fridays and Tuesdays. This place ROCKS! :D
So much better then the old one,  clean,  modern,  great service,  always consistent.  Great for kids.

I will begin this review by saying that I am a huge fan of red robin food. Their burgers are delicious every time!  Why only three stars? Because the service at this location is extremely hit and miss. Sometimes you get a really good, attentive waiter or waitress, but this is not always the case. For example, my boyfriend and I went here for date night. Our first disappointment came when they sat us between two children's birthday parties (despite the restaurant not being very busy). Then we waited for about 15 minutes before our waitress came over, the hostess had to take our drink orders! Then, when our absentee waitress did decide to show up, she was less than wonderful. She got snippy with me when I asked for no tomato on my burger. And then she took forever to bring refills, sauces, etc. Not cool.  Another thing worth mentioning, I used the rest room on this visit and it was DISGUSTING!!!! This usually isn't something I knit-pick because I know restaurants get busy but this was particularly bad especially considering it wasn't that busy! And like I said sometime you get lucky and get an amazing server but sometimes you have an experience like this. But in my opinion the food is worth it.  Bottom line: great food, spotty service.

The new red robin took a page out of Apple Bees putting the tables  one foot apart, I don't know who we had dinner with last night but we were that close. The burgers were so well done they tasted like charcoal. We thought we give the new Red Robin a try but will not be going back, we will stick with Bobs burgers.

The new restaurant is noisy and the burgers are even smaller than before. Not worth the price for sure. The burgers used to be outstanding but when they shrunk the size the quality went down as well. Sad to see an institution like it was go so commercial that it doesn't even resemble what it was previously. Service was mediocre and spent a lot of time waiting for things to be delivered. I mean really seven french fries is all.

New location smaller, noisy, worst service I have ver had, many Red Robins over the years this was bad, everything small, should have stayed the way it was, probably lost a lifelong customer.   Shopping plaza around it got a rework and they need to realize theres lots of competition in the same parking, dont have high hope ed for Red Robin, building b best used for another taco joint

The service is good if you eat in the bar. The food is good for a burger place. The onion rings are the best. I love the merry moscato punch. The drinks are priced well for the amount of alcohol you get.

Sorry that others wrote such bad reviews. After all the remodeling was done three of us went there for dinner. It was busy but our waiter was terrific and the food was great.  I say give it one more try.  All restaurants have bad nights.

I will start by saying they are very busy!   On a business trip to Yakima and following a long drive wanted something quick and easy! Glass of wine took a long time.  I realized when my burger arrived that she hadn't asked me how I wanted it!   I would have asked for medium (it came well done) and was Luke warm!   Having said that it was still good, the fries were hot, and she did ask me if I wanted more fries (I was good and declined)! In and out in 45 minutes for less than $18 - I would come back!

I used to love eating at this restaurant actually it used to be my ultimate favorite,  but now the food is absolutely disgusting.  The food has gone down hill fast.  I used to enjoy taking friends and family here to eat. But no more I have eaten here twice just to make sure it wasn't a fluke but it was sickening both times.   I will not be returning until I see good reviews.

I do not make a habit of writing bad posts for restaurants but, I haven't been to red robin for a long time due to a previous bad experience. I must say this is the worst experience I have had at any restaurant. If I could give a zero star I would have. Super Slow service. We didn't even meet our server until after we ordered! The hostess took our order. Then I had to go and ask a different sever for our milkshake my son ordered 30 minutes before! I'm not sure there was a manager on site. If so, we did not see or hear from them. Cold food. Everything came out cold. The staff that were here were messing around in the back. We will not be back here. Yakima has too many good burger places to waste here at Red Robin. So, I suggest you don't come either.
Wonderful food, GREAT  service,  very accommodating to my special diet!  Highly recommended them!

Once again a chain comes to Yakima is good for a bit then declines. Thus is my 2nd visit since the reopen. All the pros brought in for the launch are gone. Our order took 25 minutes after seating. Food was average to slow in arriving. Three orders wrong including one that had to be redone for the b-day guest. Got fries instead of salad and after the switch had wrong dressing. No napkins or silverware until meals were on table for 10 minutes. Hey RR why don't you stop the clapping show and do some damn wait service. Get the basics down then you can try and clap and sing. Glad someone else paid tonight ir I'd really be unhappy.

We come here for lunch today around 2pm, I always come here during the Xmas time with my family, we got a great table, and food was fast, just the customer service was bad, we got our drinks and food but there are no Dinner Knives, Forks, and Spoons we have to asked 3 times to get that OMG! I only see the waiter 2 times he took the order and gave us the bill, next time we will try somewhere else, the food always the same just the customer service is not there anymore sad ...

I miss the old Red Robin. First experience my bf and i sat in the bar..one of 3 couples in there and were completely ignored. The appetizer took FOREVER, and after the waitress came over multiple times saying it was almost ready she then came back and said they actually didn't have it. THEN when our food came they gave me the wrong burger..the waitress insisted I was wrong and when she took it back to the kitchen she came back and confirmed  they definitely gave me the wrong burger. On top of all this my bf cut his lip on their beer glass. Just this weekend I decided to give it another try and went with my parents and they served my dad a raw burger. Won't be back. They need to get their sh*t figured out.

What a terrible experience this time around. Usually they're great but tonight was not good. Ordered the onion ring tower which we got AFTER our burgers came. Took the lady forever to get refills despite her section only having a few tables.  To top it all off we were sat near the kitchen and the foul language emanating from it. I'll strongly reconsider ever going there again.

I came here for my 3 year olds birthday left w/o a happy birthday from anyone not our server or the hostess both of which we told! No song or balloon Nothing!!! Our meal took quite a long time as well 35/40 min wait and our server says it's because she was waiting on mandarin oranges??!!? Umm no! A burger a chicken burger Mac n cheese and cheese pizza should not take that long especially since 3tables that came in after us got their food before our table ?!??!

Service is horrible,  portion sizes have been cut. They definitely don't live up to their promise of bottomless fries. Food was not as good as it used to be.  I had family come in from out of town and I was completely embarrassed by the lack of service and the quality of food. I won't be returning anytime soon.

The Good: Good food. Fast service despite the rush. Server was friendly and prompt.  The Bad: The women's bathroom was disgusting. Floor looked like it had not been cleaned in quite some time and there was toilet paper all over the floor.

The two stars are merely there for the pleasant greeters at the door and our very nice server. The rest of the experience deserves no stars. This was the third strike for the new Red Robin location with my family. The food has been dry and lukewarm. My burger had a great deal of griddle debris coating it.  It seems like it would be hard to mess up beer but,,,  the Iron Horse beer was flat out of the keg. One huge personal growl comes when restaurants eliminate paper towels from the restroom. Wash your hands. Dry them in an air-blown petri dish that blows around other people's dirty hand soup back onto yours. Then grab the unwashed door handle with a still-damp hand following the person who didn't even bother with the aforementioned process. I wonder if they only have air dryers for the cooks in the kitchen? If not, why not?  Oh that's right,,, because that would not be sanitary. LET'S EAT! Won't be going back.

Count us among the customers who can't stand the new setup. They told us they could fit more people in. It felt smaller, and loud. And like our baby was going to have hot food dumped on her head by wait staff tripping over the crammed in diners. Put some partitions in. People don't want to have a cafeteria experience at that price. Such a disappointment in a go to restaurant.

Good food, okay service. I'd recommend this place to others. Seems like the prices are a little higher at this red robin than any other I've been to. The option for a quality gluten free burger has made this my wife's favorite restaurant.
Food is pretty good here. Great fish and chips. The waitress nicole is s little bit short with us, not bad for yakima, but in a bigger city she would be eliminated from the team.

The food here was good, but the service was not. This is sad, because Mikayla started out so well. She brought fries for munching until our food came out and was prompt with refills (even though she switched some of our drinks). However, once the food arrived for 5/6 of us, she disappeared. Fifteen minutes after my mother-in-law insisted we go ahead and start without her, she was sitting awkwardly (and hungrily) without a salad. Since no server was in sight for several minutes, my father-in-law ventured to the kitchen to see what the deal was. Five minutes later, the salad arrived and my MIL started her meal as everyone else was finishing.  A few minutes later, the manager came over and offered to take $5 off the cost of the salad due to the delay, which was appreciated. Red Robin, please, if timing isn't your kitchen's forte, please know that I would rather everyone's food sit under the heat lamp for a short time than see my MIL sit without food for 15+ while everyone else eats. It's so incredibly rude to serve part of a table!

Just tried to eat at the Yakima Red Robin and the service was awful.  Sat in the bar for 15 minutes: no water, no menus, no drinks.  We were totally ignored by the bartender and wait staff.  We got up to leave and told the hostess we were going some where else to eat.  She got the manager and told her where we where sitting and said she would speak to the bartender.  This is the third bad experience we have had here and will not go back.  The food has gone down hill and the service is horrible.  Red Robin was our go to place at the old location, at least three or four times a month.

Not a big fan of chains, but we stopped in here for a late dinner (late being 9pm...which is late for Yakima...and eastern Washington).  We had just hiked Cowiche Canyon and were famished. Stephanie was our server and she took care of us nicely.  I had a pint of Irish Death (they have it on tap as well as some Yakima Craft ales) and a pineapple burger.   The burger was just fine, and the beer, well, it's Irish Death---it's always good! If you are desperate for dinner when many other places are close, this is a Nob Hill option.

Good food but the facility is scary old and run down all though looks like they might be moving to a new building soon. Service always seems to be a hit and miss some nights really good some nights it's horrible.  But all in all the food is good.

As with almost all red Robbins I've been to this place is really busy and loud. I give it four stars based on the quality of the food. The service is often hit and miss as the other reviews stated. This seems to be one of the only locations when I order a hamburger with no pink that I actually get a hamburger that is cooked instead of a hamburger that is rare.

I grew up going to this place. I moved away 10 years ago, and I still manage to make my way back. I stopped at another burger joint on my way home last weekend, because it was closer to the freeway, and I regretted it.  The reasons that I love Yakima Red Robin: 1. There is usually a wait, not long, but I've learned that there is a wait for a reason, people want to be there, because they are doing things right.  2. ALL of the staff is ALWAYS friendly, you genuinely feel welcome.  3. No matter how busy they are, you get good service. 4. The prices and portions are appropriate.  5. The food is GREAT! 6. The atmosphere and the decor is PERFECT for a burger establishment. 7. They are the BEST for making special occasions important.  8. I leave feeling full, and happy, I get what I payed for.  I should have written this a long time ago, I should not have waited for a bad experience elsewhere to realize how much I appreciate my experiences here.  I have been, and will be a life long customer!
Great family restraunt. :) glad i came to a restraunt with such amazing workers and grwat service!

I'm sorry, but this was the worst hamburger I have ever had. I was so disappointed I could hardly speak. I wanted very badly to send it back, but we couldn't wait to leave. I'm old enough to remember the original Red Robin in the University district. The trick was you tried to eat the burger without asking for a fork to finish. Well, those days are gone. This thing was dry as a bone, no mayo, and the "endless" fries are a joke. I got 5, yes we counted, 5 to start with and never a mention of more. Service was just OK.

We called ahead for 25 people but actually had almost 50 and Teresa and her staff were INCREDIBLE and accommodating.  They got us seated in a timely matter and never lost their smile.  The food was great as usual and their customer service was top notch!
One of my favorite burger places in Yakima. Their service can get somewhat bad if they are packed. It happens sometimes.
Its a Red Robin like all the other Red Robins only thing is that in Yakima this Red Robin gets BUSY AND PACKED WITH PEOPLE!

Ate hear last weekend for a family birthday party! The staff was amazing of course like they always are! Very accommodating to our big group we were with! Our waitress wish I could remember her name was amazing!! So for a great burger and awesome lemonade..lol come here!! Ohh their green beer wasn't bad either as we were there on st pattys day!! :)

So on Friday I took the oldest to Red Robin to get a quick bite to eat before helping at movie night. We were a bit apprehensive as our last visit was so terrible. We got there at nearly the same time as the last visit (5:00) and unlike our last trip there were hardly anyone in the restaurant or waiting for a table. I surmised this was because of all the poor service and poor reviews. I let our waiter know we were in a hurry and he was very nice and promptly took our order. I ordered sweet potato fries for Ashley and we both got soup. So, nothing spectacular nor nothing that would need to take a lot of cooking. Our service was fantastic. The app came quickly and then the soup. I mad a point to tell the server when I gave him my discount card (mailed after I sent a scathing email to their corporate people after the last visit) about how pleased I was with the service. He brought the manager over and we had a long talk about the last visit and the noticeable changes. Turns out the manager is new, he was promoted 2 months ago. I told him that I would be sure to write a good review on facebook and on yelp to let people know they are improving. He acknowledged the buildings design is ridiculous and that there were lots of issues with new servers not having the personalities or ability to provide good service. So, if you have gone and had a crappy night like we did before. I say, give them another shot. Good management is key to good service and I think they really are making good changes.
Good place for a burger and beer. Can get a little loud at times

A group of us went to the yakima red robin for a send off to the U.S. Army, while the food was good but the wait staff was not! The guest of honor order was not taken until after most people were served and I had to reorder my meal because it was lost somewhere in la la land which describes the service very well.
